contentList.content: Find him, bind him, tie him to a pole and break his fingers to splinters. Drag him to a hole until he wakes up naked clawing at the ceiling of his grave.
The owner of this maul was known for keeping order on the graveyard shift.
The owner of this maul was known for the MISERY they brought to others.
According to Lorroakan, these are nothing but "Meaningless cantrips and playthings." Yet you can tell someone has studied it closely, tried to copy the formula, and failed.
With enough persistence, even the brightest lights can be snuffed.
This weapon deals additional damage equal to your Intelligence modifier, and may temporarily Silence targets. Uses your Intelligence if higher than Dexterity for attack rolls.

These exceptional bows are often forged in pairs, designed specially for tanar'ri called "Arrow Demons." These four-armed brutes are some of the most feared archers of the Blood War. Uses your Wisdom if higher than Dexterity, and adds your WIS bonus to damage.

This bow is an impossible alchemy of metals. The string is a ductile adamantine strand, and the bow is marked with arcane runes. Unfortunately, years of Mimic stomach acid has faded the magic, and this bow is now unreliable. Deals random amounts of bonus elemental damage.
Glary Galloway said one day, "There is no way to see and slay!" So his enemies, who hide and play, thought that Glary was easy prey. Until he invented these.
Never drop anything ever again - even if you want to!
This necklace is an amalgamation of metals and gems dedicated to divinity across the Forgotten Realms - and beyond.
This necklace is an amalgamation of metals and gems dedicated to every profanity you can imagine - and some you can't.
I will be the last creature when I am done. The cosmos will then be perfect, free of the braying abominations that are all other living things.
Women fear me. Fish love me.
A Solar's prized weapon, somehow in Helsik's shop.

This greataxe was forged to seal a friendship, after the fire giant Jadeowyn Flamepearl was saved from slaving duergar and Kalarel the Vile. It is forged from meteorite and dedicated to righteousness.

This greataxe was forged to seal a friendship, after the fire giant Jadeowyn Flamepearl was saved from slaving duergar and Kalarel the Vile. It is forged from meteorite and dedicated to righteousness.

At a distance, this sword looks rusted and pitted. Upon closer inspection, it is a highly polished exotic metal - and it reflects a twisted image of the world around you, ruined and decayed. It whispers to you: I am Moghadam. And I am hunger.
This 'shield' is a chunk of Flail Snail shell, a creature native to the Elemental Plane of Earth infamous for reflecting spells right back at their enemies.
Allegedly, this armor is fashioned from the scales of a dragon deity for albino kobolds.
Somewhere a fancy drow wants his cloak back.
Me grandfather died in this cloak and t'is an honor to see it in battle again!
Lumaterian was a price-performance enthusiast. She wanted her magical effective, but economical. Unfortunately this experiment is questionable for both.
Lumaterian was a price-performance enthusiast. She wanted her magical effective, but economical. Unfortunately this experiment is questionable for both.
This cloak was fashioned by a powerful spore druid who hunted cultists of Juiblex.
This scimitar cuts to the heart of dispute.

Doin good, sometimes even just seein other people do good... Tha feelin gets ta ye eventually. Sometimes I think tha only reason more evil folks dinnae succomb ta it is tha it feels bad ta realize how bad ye been! Most rather pretend ta neva feel nuthin than experience tha pain.
Your powers come from ancient forces of chaos. They churn within you - waiting to burst free at any time.

Unruly magic sparks and fizzes through your veins.

Each time you cast a spell of Level 1 or higher, your magic might surge and trigger a random magical effect.
Once per <LSTag Tooltip="LongRest">Long Rest</LSTag> when you use Wild Shape you have a 50 percent chance to trigger <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic Surge</LSTag>.
Sometimes magic works in mysterious ways

Your allies will regain the maximum <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">hit points</LSTag> possible when healed. They also gain <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag> and Death Saving Throws.
Retreat safely: moving won't provoke <LSTag Tooltip="OpportunityAttack">Opportunity Attacks</LSTag>.
Two gremishkas are born from your blood in a wild outburst.
Transform into a tiny mist cloud. It can't fall, and fits through small openings. It is very hard to damage.
The cloud has <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Constitution, Dexterity, and Strength <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saving Throws</LSTag>.
Transform into a tiny mist cloud. It can't fall, and fits through small openings. It is very hard to damage.
Submit to the coaxing of the tadpole. Your very morphology will shift. The pain will be incredible. Once it is over, you will be a mind flayer.
Send everyone around you into a <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="RAGE">Rage</LSTag>.
Affected entity has embraced ceremorphosis and become a mind flayer.
Call down a beam of light that damages any creature that enters the beam or starts its turn in the light. You can use an action to move the beam [1].
Charm nearby creatures with a magical melody to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="LURING_SONG">Lure</LSTag> them to you.
Charm nearby creatures with a magical melody to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="LURING_SONG">Lure</LSTag> them to you.

While in Slayer form, you can't talk or cast spells.

When your Slayer form drops to 0 hit points, you revert to your normal form.
Manifest your savage compulsions and assume your sinuously deadly Slayer form. Your Slayer form has [1] (increases to [2] at Level 10).
Induce a <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic Surge</LSTag> on the nearby spellcaster.
Foes may suffer a <LSTag Type="Passive" Tooltip="WildMagic">Wild Magic Surge</LSTag> while casting spells near your fluctuating magic.
Each creature within [1] is randomly transformed into a rat.
Target an enemy that's casting a spell. They will unleash a wild magic surge on themselves.
Call forth spirits to protect the area around you.
Nearby enemies take [1] per turn, and their <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> is halved.
Wild Magic: Charm Animals and Plants
Channel fey magic to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="CHARMED">Charm</LSTag> nearby beasts and plants.
Each charater within earshot can move an additional [1] during their next turn.
Called the wrong thing - better luck next time
Bolster nearby allies with a supernatural resolve. Their attacks deal an additional [1].
A sudden urge to sing and dance. At least it's not a dark urge.

Gravity on the Astral Plane is different than on Faer√ªn.

The affected entity is Immune to Falling damage and its Jump distance is tripled.
Gain [1] and deal an additional [2] while you have them. Cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_HaloOfSpores">Halo of Spores</LSTag> with double damage.

You and everyone around can't be poisoned, diseased, or frightened. Your <LSTag Tooltip="HitPoints">HP</LSTag> increases, and you make Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="SavingThrow">Saves</LSTag> with <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag>.
Emit the stench of tomb mould and abattoirs to <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="STINKING_CLOUD">Nauseate</LSTag> nearby foes.
Nausea can be cleared if targets become <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="WET">Wet</LSTag>.
Explode in a burst of sticky mud. It dries instantly on any nearby creatures not made of mud, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="MEPHIT_MUD_RESTRAINED">Restraining</LSTag> and hurting them.
Exude terror, instilling <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FEARED">Fear</LSTag> in your foes.
Let out a blood-curdling howl that <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FRIGHTENED">Frightens</LSTag> all beasts and humanoids that hear it.
Transform into a displacer beast that can <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Teleportation_Displacement_DisplacerBeast">Displace</LSTag> itself and enemies, and has [1].

You take on the attributes of a displacer beast, but maintain your Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma scores.

When your displacer beast form drops to [1] hit points, you revert to your original form.
Enemies take [1] per turn and can't take reactions.
Each creature within [1] starts burning and takes [2] per turn.
Grants your allies <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on <LSTag Tooltip="AttackRoll">Attack Rolls</LSTag> when they attack a target within [1] of another ally.
Cause a creature to start dancing, making it unable to take actions or move. Its attackers have <LSTag Tooltip="Advantage">Advantage</LSTag> on Attack Rolls.
Command a creature to drop its weapon.
Command a creature to fall <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag> on its turn.
Command an ally in the Dark Lord's name, letting them channel <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_BanesWrath">Bane's Wrath</LSTag>.
Roar at nearby enemies to goad them into attacking you.
Wreathe your body in flames that shed light in a [1] radius, provide <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">Resistance</LSTag> to Fire or Cold damage, and retaliate against melee attacks.
Conjure a flaming scimitar in your hand.
Roar at nearby enemies to goad them into attacking you.
You and any nearby allies take only <LSTag Tooltip="Resistant">half the damage</LSTag> from spells. The aura disappears if you fall Unconscious.
Manifest your savage compulsions and assume your sinuously deadly Slayer form. Your Slayer form has [1] (increases to [2] at Level 10).

While in Slayer form, you can't talk or cast spells.

When your Slayer form drops to 0 hit points, you revert to your normal form.
Speak the commands Myrkul whispers in your ear, and pull all nearby creatures towards you.
As a last resort, initiate a countdown sequence that ends with <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Projectile_SteelWatcher_Biped_SelfDestructExplosion">Self-Detonation</LSTag>.
Reduce the next damage taken by the entity to [1] and consumes one charge of Unstoppable. Unstoppable creatures cannot be moved by any external forces - mundane or magical.
Sprout cursed roots and vines all around you, slowing non-plant creatures and possibly <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="ENSNARED_VINES">Entangling</LSTag> enemies.
Take the shape of a small or medium creature you've seen.

Take the shape of a deva that can cast <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_Wrathful_Smite_Deva">Wrathful Smite</LSTag>, <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Teleportation_Revivify">Revivify</LSTag>, and <LSTag Type="Spell" Tooltip="Target_ConcussiveSmash">Concussive Smash</LSTag>. It has [1].

Harden your slippery body into a substance like steel, increasing your <LSTag Tooltip="ArmourClass">Armour Class</LSTag> by [1], but reducing your <LSTag Tooltip="MovementSpeed">movement speed</LSTag> by [2].
Wild Magic: Radiance of the Dawn
The sun's divine power dispels any magical darkness.
Doesn't affect creatures that have total cover from you.
Stomp the ground to cause a massive shockwave and knock nearby creatures <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="PRONE">Prone</LSTag>.
Your spellcasting can unleash unpredictable surges of untamed magic.
Temporarily <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="BANISHED">Banish</LSTag> your target to another plane of existence.
Atrophy a foe, <LSTag Type="Status" Tooltip="FLESH_TO_STONE_1">Restraining</LSTag> them until they temporarily turn to stone.

You gain a bonus to your Persuasion <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> equal to your Wisdom <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>. You gain a bonus to your Intimidation <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityCheck">Checks</LSTag> equal to your Intelligence <LSTag Tooltip="AbilityModifier">Modifier</LSTag>.
Increases <LSTag Tooltip="Strength">Strength</LSTag> by 4, to a maximum of 24.
